ygData.subject: Re: Starting a paladin
ygData.msgSnippet: I have a human paladin w/ i believe 95 charisma. While not sure if there is a huge difference (maybe at higher levels) I have noticed people selling things to
ygData.messageBody:
I have a human paladin w/ i believe 95 charisma. While not sure if there is
a huge difference (maybe at higher levels) I have noticed people selling
things to players for cheaper then i can sell to vendors (Like Greater
Lightstones for 4pp, which I can sell to vendors for more then that). I was
able to buy a combine longsword for 53pp and I have heard of others paying
up to 60pp. I personally like the higher carisma and hope to find some items
to raise it even more.

Adol


>From: Dragon <dracon@...>
>Reply-To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
>To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Starting a paladin
>Date: Wed, 09 Jun 1999 06:08:18 +0800
>
>From: Dragon <dracon@...>
>
> I have decided that i will play either a human or dwarf paladin and will
>like to ask some questions. Any help is greatly appreciated.
>
>1) Will human gets alot less HP per level at 80 STA than dwarf which has
>95
>STA?
>
>2) I will like to know how do i distribute the points to make the dwarf
>paladin better in melee( more STR, STA, AGI or DEX , which stat is
>better?)
>
>3) does human paladin level alot faster than dwarf paladin?
>
>4) Do dwarf paladins get very lousy prices when buying or selling at 55
>charisma compared to a human 85 (how significant is the difference), will
>charisma affect the prices when u deal with your own guild ?
>
>5) Anyone has any formula in calculating Hitpoint gained per level? Is the
>difference significant for a 80 STA and 95 STA?
>
>
>
>
>David Rogers wrote:
>
> > From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
> >
> > --- Dragon <dracon@...> wrote:
> > > Will Dwarf's 60 INT makes increment in skill point
> > > REAL slow??
> >
> > I haven't had any unplayable problems. My skills are
> > all level capped; only took me 1 1-2 levels to bring
> > Parry up from 17 to 90 (at 18th). I brought Archery
> > up to 75 in about 5 hours. I have a -2 under level
> > cap Swimming, capped Sense Heading, 56 Fletching, 55
> > Smithing, etc....
> >
> > ===
